title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct expression (ion charges must be present; parentheses instead of square brackets not accepted).

Ksp = [Ag+][Br−]
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct expression (ion charges must be present; parentheses instead of square brackets not accepted).

Ksp = [Ag+][Br−]

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for the correct expression (ion charges must be present; parentheses instead of square brackets not accepted).

Ksp = [Ag+][Br−]

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct value with support work (units not necessary).

Let x = equilibrium concentration of Ag+ (and of Br−).

Then Ksp = 5.0 x 10−13 = x2 ⇒ x = 7.1 x 10−7 M

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the correct answer with justification.

The value of [Ag+] after addition of distilled water is equal to the value in part (b). The concentration of ions in solution in equilibrium with a solid does not depend on the volume of the solution.
descriptions:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for calculation of concentration of ions.

[Ag + ]= (10.0 mL)(1.5× 10 −4 M) 12.0 mL =1.3× 10 −4 M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGBbGaaeyqaiaabEgada ahaaWcbeqaaiabgUcaRaaakiaac2facqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaacIca caaIXaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGmbGaaeykai aabIcacaqGXaGaaeOlaiaabwdacqGHxdaTcaqGXaGaaeimamaaCaaa leqabaGaeyOeI0IaaGinaaaakiaad2eacaGGPaaabaGaaGymaiaaik dacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbGaaeitaaaacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGa aiOlaiaaiodacqGHxdaTcaaIXaGaaGimamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0 IaaGinaaaakiaad2eaaaa@57CF@

[Br − ]= (2.0 mL)(5.0× 10 −4 M) 12.0 mL =8.3× 10 −5 M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGBbGaaeOqaiaabkhada ahaaWcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaakiaac2facqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaacIca caaIYaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaabYeacaqGPaGaaeikai aabwdacaqGUaGaaeimaiabgEna0kaabgdacaqGWaWaaWbaaSqabeaa cqGHsislcaaI0aaaaOGaamytaiaacMcaaeaacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGmbaaaiabg2da9iaaiIdacaGGUaGa aG4maiabgEna0kaaigdacaaIWaWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaI1a aaaOGaamytaaaa@5734@

1 point is earned for calculation of Q and conclusion based on comparison between Q and Ksp.

Q = [Ag+][Br−] = (1.3 x 10-4 M)(8.3 x 10-5 M) = 1.1 x 10-8

1 point is earned for indicating the precipitation of AgBr.

1.1 x 10-8 > 5.0 x 10-13, ∴ a precipitate will form.

[Ag + ]= (10.0 mL)(1.5× 10 −4 M) 12.0 mL =1.3× 10 −4 M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGBbGaaeyqaiaabEgada ahaaWcbeqaaiabgUcaRaaakiaac2facqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaacIca caaIXaGaaGimaiaac6cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGmbGaaeykai aabIcacaqGXaGaaeOlaiaabwdacqGHxdaTcaqGXaGaaeimamaaCaaa leqabaGaeyOeI0IaaGinaaaakiaad2eacaGGPaaabaGaaGymaiaaik dacaGGUaGaaGimaiaabccacaqGTbGaaeitaaaacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGa aiOlaiaaiodacqGHxdaTcaaIXaGaaGimamaaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0 IaaGinaaaakiaad2eaaaa@57CF@

[Br − ]= (2.0 mL)(5.0× 10 −4 M) 12.0 mL =8.3× 10 −5 M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGBbGaaeOqaiaabkhada ahaaWcbeqaaiabgkHiTaaakiaac2facqGH9aqpdaWcaaqaaiaacIca caaIYaGaaiOlaiaaicdacaqGGaGaaeyBaiaabYeacaqGPaGaaeikai aabwdacaqGUaGaaeimaiabgEna0kaabgdacaqGWaWaaWbaaSqabeaa cqGHsislcaaI0aaaaOGaamytaiaacMcaaeaacaaIXaGaaGOmaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaeiiaiaab2gacaqGmbaaaiabg2da9iaaiIdacaGGUaGa aG4maiabgEna0kaaigdacaaIWaWaaWbaaSqabeaacqGHsislcaaI1a aaaOGaamytaaaa@5734@

1 point is earned for calculation of Q and conclusion based on comparison between Q and Ksp.

Q = [Ag+][Br−] = (1.3 x 10-4 M)(8.3 x 10-5 M) = 1.1 x 10-8

1 point is earned for indicating the precipitation of AgBr.

1.1 x 10-8 > 5.0 x 10-13, ∴ a precipitate will form.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
• 1 point is earned for the correct equation.

    AgBr(s) + I−(aq) → AgI(s) + Br−(aq)

    OR

    AgBr(s) + NaI(aq) → AgI(s) + NaBr(aq)

  • 1 point is earned for the correct choice with justification.

    AgBr has the greater value of Ksp. The precipitate will consist of the less soluble salt when both I−(aq) and Br−(aq) are present. Because the color of the precipitate in the test tube turns yellow, it must be AgI(s) that precipitates; therefore Ksp for AgBr must be greater than Ksp for AgI.

    OR

    Keq for the displacement reaction is K s p  of AgBr K s p  of AgI MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfwBIj xAHbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8srps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaadUeadaWgaa WcbaGaam4CaiaadchaaeqaaOGaaeiiaiaab+gacaqGMbGaaeiiaiaa bgeacaqGNbGaaeOqaiaabkhaaeaacaWGlbWaaSbaaSqaaiaadohaca WGWbaabeaakiaabccacaqGVbGaaeOzaiaabccacaqGbbGaae4zaiaa bMeaaaaaaa@4556@ . Because yellow AgI forms, Keq > 1; therefore Ksp of AgBr > Ksp of AgI.
